Replies.Reply: MUSIC BUILDS. FASTER. Keane brochures. Catalogs. A flyer: "Now Open! Keane Gallery"
Good luck.
Nah.
But that IS me! And that's me...
And that one started as me, but then Mother turned it into a Chinese boy.
Mother, after all this time, you MUST know what my face looks like.
Hey! Your canvas is blank!
A-hem!
I remember when Momma painted that.
Sure I'm sure! It was in our old apartment, and you had me sit on a stool in the kitchen --
No, Mother did! Look! I'm wearing my blue dress.
Well you did a really good job.
Mom! I wanna come in.
Let me in! What are you doing in there? Why's the door always locked?
Who's that?
Do you live far away?
"Twenty minutes"?! That's close!
But you never see Walter?
Huh? Uh... sure. I guess a little.
Does he talk about me?
So what's your mom like?
Yeah, mine's the same.
Except she drives a Packard.
I have some peanut butter hidden in my sock drawer. Do you wanna eat it?
Go, Rembrandt! Get the ball!
Can I come?
No. I can never come. No! I shouldn't even ask.
Mom, what's for dinner?
Mom! Are you home...?
Mom... I know.
I'm not a child anymore.
Ow!
Mom, what are we gonna do??!
But where are we going?
We don't even have any clothes!
Really...?
No, I'm gonna surf with the gang.
Loosen up, Mom! You're impossible!
That's right! Or they'd see the precious paintings!!
I just can't believe you let people in the house.
Hey. Is Jehovah okay with suing??
We don't get many ladies in here. So your husband approves of you working?
"Separated"?
You do understand this is a furniture company?
My husband and I are separated.
Sir, I realize I have no employment experience... but I sure need this job. I have a daughter to support.
I'm not very good at tooting my own horn... but I love to paint, and if I could just show you my portfolio...
I studied at the Watkins Art Institute in Nashville, then took Illustration classes in New York. Here's a pastel I did... here's some fashion design...
Deirdre, look at you!
"Dee-Ann"?!
Jane -- is swell. She's started in a sweet little school.
Though... it's hard without her father.
You were a bridesmaid!
Do they only show Modern?
What's espresso?
Is that like reefer?
Today's a special: Two dollars.
All finished.
I'm just glad they liked it.
M-Margaret...
Wouldn't you rather flirt with those dolls over there?
Mr. Ulbrich is out of the picture...!
I can't believe you lived in Paris.
I've never even been on an airplane.
You're a romantic.
I've never acted freely. I was the daughter. The wife. The mother...
All my paintings are of Jane, because she's all I know.
Walter, I'd bet you could paint anything.
This is moving fast. You're my first date in a long time...
Sweetie, could you stop fidgeting?
Jane! Don't bother Mr. Keane. You know creativity has to well up from the inside...
I believe things can be seen in eyes.
Eyes are how I express my emotions.
What was that??
You're a -- Realtor?
And you're... ashamed?
Frank wants to take away Jane. He says I'm an unfit mother...
He told the court Jane doesn't have a proper home. It's beyond my abilities as a single woman...
Walter! I --
"Hawaii"? M-marriage?
Walter, I'm crazy about you... but I'm overwhelmed. Why would we go to Hawaii?!
You're right... this is paradise.
Oh, can't we stay here forever??

This is a waterfall... the air was so fresh you could taste it. Here's an ancient altar... that statue is Kane, the god of creation. I said a prayer to him. Oh! Here's Walter and Janie, building a sandcastle --
I thought there was a void in my life.
You're talking about my husband!
I'm not naive.
"You are on the threshold of untold success."
I think people buy art because it touches them --
I've never posted bail before.
Since when are you thin-skinned?
I don't understand. Why would you do such a thing?!
Don't ever do it again.
There must be two-hundred dollars...
Walter, they take at least a week.
Mrs. Cava, I'm sorry to bother you so late... but would you mind watching Jane?
Walter...?
Why are you lying?
You're taking credit for something that isn't yours.
Those children are part of my being!
They couldn't meet me, because you told me to stay home!!
You take this so lightly --
I'm glad you can dash off your pieces without any emotional connection...!
Don't you mean... one of your good ones?
What about... honesty?
But... isn't it strange? Artists get shown. They don't build their own galleries.
Are you -- sure? That was a long time ago.
L-lots of girls have that dress...
Hello. I've -- never really done this before. I'm not sure how you...
I was raised Methodist. If it's a problem, I can go --
I lied to my child.
My husband... he pressured me into doing it.
I've never lied to her before. I'm not that kind of person.
Ummm, no. I don't think of him that way. I mean, he likes to tell stories... maybe he exaggerates a little... but he's a good man.
He takes care of us. He wants to make enough money to buy our family a house...
"Harm"?? Oh! Not at all.
I'm just looking for answers...
N-no. That's not what --
Oh. Um, we decided that this would be Walter's show --
Well... he's more established.
Thanks for coming.
I don't... know.
Uhh, you can't. Mommy's busy.
I dunno. I'm not really comfortable with this. Jane and I used to be so close... but -- now...
Maybe I'm lightheaded from the turpentine. I've been in here all day.
Do you -- like it?
No. The secret is the shadow. I shadowed the eyelid.
Is that your best version of sincerity?
You're going to be on television?!
Maybe you have an unhealthy obsession with little girls.
I guess you've painted yourself into a corner.
Walter... art is personal.
What about your Paris street scenes?
And was it really all sun-dappled streets and flower vendors?
What time is it?
I've been... busy.
No --! It's just... something I'm working on. It's not for the world.
No, please! Walter, it's -- personal.
Yes it is.
It's a self-portrait.
I thought... maybe... I could sign it myself.
Yes, I know... but... when people ask me if I paint, I don't know what to answer! I just want the pride of being able to say -- that's mine.
Nobody!
No! NOBODY saw it!
I KNOW! My God! I live with this every minute of my life!
Janie used to have a mother who painted. Now what's she think?! I lock myself in this room ten hours a day... and then you walk out with finished paintings!
C'mon! You haven't picked up a brush in months!
We used to paint together! Easels next to each other, side-by-side --
I've kept my end of the bargain! I've never told!
Please! Just let me have this!
What about Georgia O'Keefe?
Oh... from the world around me. And I love Modigliani's use of line.
Walter?
Walter! We need to speak.
What is going on here??!
No you didn't.
Did she just move in??
How can you keep something so big a secret???
I'm sure she is.
I'm gonna pretend you didn't say that.
I painted it!
Yes, we don't use my name, since people don't take women's art seriously.
"MDH" are my initials. And more! I'm interested in numerology... and as you know, seven is a very good number.

Luckily, my maiden name is Margaret Doris Hawkins! "M" is the 13th letter of the alphabet, "D" is 4, "H" 8! If you add up 1 and 3 in 13, that gives you 4, making 4 plus 4 plus 8 equals 16, then 1 plus 6 equals seven!
Rembrandt, shush!
Yeah. That driveway is long.
Honestly, I can't believe I live here.
What?
Oh, please! She's Walter's friend.
He brings people by... the Beach Boys were here. But, it's pretty isolated.
Jane has nice friends. Sometimes I pick them up at the junior high, and we all get pizza.
But she's busy... Are you hungry?
Good! I'll whip us up two gin fizzes.
When we moved in, I thought a wet bar was extravagant... but it's surprising how much use you can get out of it.
He couldn't be happier. He has everything he ever dreamed of.
No --! You can't go in --
Dee-Ann, please! STOP --
W-Walter paints in here too.
Uh... Dee-Ann was just... she...
I won't.
Okay, honey. I have to go work.
Where did you appear from? Didn't you hear? No visitors!
Is this what it's come to? You're the only living soul I can tell my secret?
Well -- I painted them all!
It's TRUE! I did every single one --
Well, every one except that street scene.
But I did the rest. Every Big Eye!
No you don't! It's nice to have company, but that sofa is new.
Let's find you some carpet to lay on.
I think there's a scrap back here...
Well what's this?
Maybe you should give her one of your street scenes.
No, Walter. She's a dignitary.
Unless Madame Chiang Kai-shek already has a Cenic.
Cenic is the name of the artist who did all your early paintings.
The more you lie, the smaller you seem.
Then why do you paint over the name?
A bit of advice: Don't use a water-
No, I haven't.
Walter?
Have you even been to Paris?
I don't want you sleeping in this room any longer. I -- I can't keep living these lies.
There's three extra bedrooms. Go pick one.
A new MDH. Something for me. It's about a woman trapped in an uncaring world. I call it, "Escape."
What?
And then -- YOU'LL paint them?
Walter, this isn't paint-by-numbers!
If you knew the basics, you wouldn't be at the easel. You have to sketch it first!
I dunno. You tell me. You're the creator.
Oh, a Keane! How witty.
You know, when we met all those years ago, I never would've imagined in my wildest dreams that one day --
How old is the subject?
It matters! A young child's head is round. An older child's head is oval!
NO I'M NOT! Every line is a decision!
It's easy to talk about art, but it's not easy to MAKE art!!
Walter!!
I know the truth.
NO! Absolutely NOT!! I still hate myself for giving you the Waifs!
Oh, I'll talk as LOUD AS I WANT --
What??!
You're threatening me...?! Fine, kill me! My God, I've kept our secret for years! I've never once --
Do you know what it's been like for me? I don't have any friends. I've lied to my own child...
What do you want, Walter? Everything with you is calculated. We're back where we had our first date...
What masterpiece?
You sound insane. Artists don't announce a masterpiece --
He worked on that for FOUR YEARS!
It's too big. Why'd you promise them Cinerama size?
You're right! Where are your preliminary sketches?? All that time in art school, and somehow we waylaid your youthful experiments! The half-
Get out of here. I'm trying to work.
W-what are you doing in here --?
Jane, you don't know anything!!
I was happier selling paintings in the park.
Friday, I file for divorce.
How could anyone... say something so cruel?
is mortified. This is all too awful. Silent, she watches Walter back out of the party...
STOP IT!
Walter!
We're leaving.
I'm sorry I wasn't the mother I could have been. I -- I should have done this years ago...
Where we're going, we won't need much.
Hawaii.
Yes, Hawaii. Because it's paradise.
Hello?
It's a decree of legal separation. I would appreciate if you signed it.
Walter, our marriage is over.
Walter, I want a divorce.
If that's the price.
My God, Walter! How much more money do you need?
Would you like to go into town? I'm stopping by the post office.
Your friends are a bit... wild.
Y-you know I can't have people over to the house.
I'm not interested.
I'm not interested in whatever you're selling.
From where I'm standing, I don't see much good anywhere. Just a lot of pride, and thievery, and people treating each other poorly.
Sounds like my ex-husband.
Would you like to come in?
It's been so long since I've been happy. But, I don't even know why I'm telling you... two complete strangers.
So you're -- Jehovah's Witnesses?
I've explored so many religions. But they all had their flaws...
And how do you know...?
Because our beliefs are supported by the Scriptures. Jehovah is the God of truth.
What does that mean, exactly?
Honesty leads to self-respect. A feeling of well-being.
It says here a worshiper of Jehovah must be honest in all things.
I have nothing to hide!
It also says no lies. "Speak truth.
No... Big Lolo. Everything you just said is false.
One: Walter is no longer my husband.
And Two: He's not... a painter.
No. Though he's been taking credit for ten years.
I'm the only painter in the family.
He made me sound crazy!!
But how can I?! He claims I copied HIM! That he taught ME how to paint!
"She used a slide projector to trace my work and fill in the colors."
ALL OF IT!
When I finally told the truth, I felt good about myself for the first time in years!! I'm not going to let him take that away.
I was forced into it. You had --
He had me dominated. He would rant and rave if I didn't do what he wanted. I was afraid. I didn't see any option, so I went along. I felt very bad...
I just gave in. I allowed him to take credit for the big eyes. They reflected all my feelings... and... it was like losing a child...
I was weak. I didn't feel I could leave and support myself and my daughter. He said nobody would buy the paintings without his personality.
Maybe he was right...
You were very talented at being charming. You were a genius at salesmanship and promotion.
That's you, Walter. Jekyll and Hyde.
No! You're outrageous! Constantly criticizing! Wearing me down! Saying I'd be "knocked off" if I ever told the truth!!
takes a pencil. She peeks over at Walter -- who's still glued to his seat. His face tight, his expression queasy. Staring off to some faraway place.
fills in more detail. Ears... nose... then, little fingers clutching a fence. The child is peeking over it, staring right at us...
peers at Walter, knowingly.
Thank you! Thank you so much.
Oh... it was never about the money.
I just wanted credit for what I had done. The justice is... I got my art back.
My prayers have been answered.
Sugar, you made it! You're in North Beach!
"Dee-Ann."
Yeah, I know. But I hit this scene...
So are you flipping for all this?!
Oh stop that. You're better off.
Exactly. That's why I couldn't speak up. But if I ever see you wrong off again, I will tell you.
Now come on. Let's have some fun.
Toss off your middle-class preconceptions! This is Pompeii!
Everyone only shows Modern!
In the basement, they've got espresso.
You've got a lot to learn!
This is all happening mighty quick.
Walter's filled a lot of things. He's diddled every skirt on the art circuit.
I know! That's why I brought it up.
Hey, baby! Killer party! It's a hap-
Oh "we" did?? And why would "we" do that??
Please! Is that you talking, or did you just turn into a little felt puppet with someone's hand up your ass?
It's strange... Walter doesn't strike me as the cute hungry kitten type...
My God! I thought I misread the address.
Whoa.
Three? I thought there were four.
Crazy. A fake daughter...
It's been so long since I've seen you.
You're probably busy, hanging out with your new rich buddies.
"Kim Novak."
I'm thirsty.
How's Walter?
And so do you! Fabulous.
Oh, is that your studio?
I just want a peek. See what the workspace of a wildly successful artist looks like --
Is Walter home??
SHUT UP! You're so full of shit, Walter!
Fuck you!
I knew it!!!
Your stuff is cute. How much?
I'll give you one.
You wanna touch it? Do it! I lay it on thick -- you're not gonna break it!
I poured myself into that painting.
Excuse me, Ladies.
You're better than spare change. You shouldn't sell yourself so cheap.
Ahhh! You're past that point! Your heart is in your work...
What's your name?
Mm, no.
I like you, Margaret...
"...Ulbrich."
You know, Margaret Ulbrich, you're undervaluing yourself. Lemme show you how it's done.
Little Girl! How would you like your portrait sketched by the World-
"Nah"?!
Don't you wish this were you in this beautiful painting??
Oh, you're Mommy! My apologies, Honey. I misconstrued the situation.
Well I'll just mosey along, before Mr.
Bonsoir, gang! Henri! Sorry I didn't call first. Est-ce que tout va bien?
Je vais bien! I'm with a beautiful woman! Could life be any grander??
And I don't even have to pay! I'm set because I gave the chef a painting.
Best time of my life...
Well you have to experience these things! Grab 'em!!
I wanted to be an artist, so I just went! Studied painting at the Beaux-
Damn right!
Of course, walkin' away from the bourgeois scene wasn't a snap. I had to quit my job. Leave my wife. These choices aren't easy...
You shouldn't knock your work. I'd give an eyetooth to have your talent.
You can look into someone and capture them on canvas! You paint people!
I can only paint -- things. My street scenes are charming... but at the end of the day, it's just a collection of sidewalks and buildings.
Whew... Baby, when you look at me like that, I could fall hard.
Er, you can't rush inspiration --
Don't worry. She's not bothering me...!
There's something I gotta ask you.
Yeah, but, c'mon! You draw 'em like pancakes! I mean, they're WAY out of proportion!
Oh! Uh... er, hi, Don.
Um... we should hear from Permits by Thursday.
I -- I didn't want you to know...
I'm in commercial real estate.
YES! A hugely successful Realtor!
Of course! Any blockhead can arrange a sublet!
All I ever wanted was to support myself as an artist...
What's wrong...?
You're a perfect mother.
Marry me.
Shh. Don't think of a reason to say no. 'Cause I've got a million reasons to say yes.
Replies.Didascalie: (he puts a finger to her lips)

Replies.Reply: I know it makes no sense!
But just think of the fun we'll have..! And I'll take care of you girls.
Margaret, I'm on my knee! C'mon, whatdya say? Let's get married! We can be in Hawaii by the weekend.
Because you're a princess... and you deserve to get married in paradise.
I knew you'd love it.
Well, I don't know about forever. But maybe... I can arrange another week.
Ruben, good day! Do you got a minute?
You're gonna love my stuff today.
Nah! That was painted in the Fifth Arrondissement. This is the Sixth Arrondissement!
It's all up here.
Hey, Art isn't fashion!
Would they want... this?
No... they're my wife's.
It's Expressionism. Surely you recognize it.
So... what do you say?
Not -- "art"??
How dare you! Lots of people would like this.
We'll never break in...! Because there's a CABAL. A secret society of gallery owners and critics, who get together for Sunday brunch in Sausalito, deciding what's "cool."
They're like Freemasons. No, worse!
Heh! You're livin' in fairy land!
Hey, Banducci. I love the music tonight. It's a gas.
I'm Walter Keane. I'm a painter.
I was looking at your walls, and they're pretty plain.
No -- I'm an artist. I used to be based on the Left Bank. But now I've relocated to the "States," and I'm looking for an... exhibition venue.
Okay! I respect that. You're a businessman, not a charity! So how 'bout if I, uh... rented your walls?
Yes! The paintings are available for public viewing daily, from 7 to 3!
Er, no. 3 a.m. It's in a nightclub.
Maggie! It's promotion time! We gotta lay the racket!
Ah, beautiful! An art lover! Yes sir, how may I help you?
Yeah.
Why, thank you...! Thank you so much!
Huh? Uh... no. No. I just didn't realize you meant... the waif.
You wouldn't know it from that broom closet you parked me in.
"Location, location, location..."
It's INSULTING! When people see art, they shouldn't think of SHIT!
I'm -- I'm sorry. Banducci... laughed at our work. ...So I socked him.
You're right! I know. But... I was already in a bad place. I'd had a couple... and earlier...
I let some guy think I painted your Big Eye.
It was a misunderstanding. And then, I didn't want to jinx the sale.
Don't give me a hard time. I'm just grabbing my stuff...
I'll see you in COURT, you son of a bitch! I'm suing you for assault!
I thought you only did celebrities.
Huh? Uh, sure --
Well, when I was in Paris...
What do you wanna know...?!
Ding-a-ling! Wake up, we're a HIT!
What a night! I sold out all your Big Eyes!!
They adore you! Cause of that article, the joint was PACKED. And then, a famous journalist showed up, and -- I need more paintings! Now!
Of course! But, this is opportunity!
...yeah, eyes are powerful. A poet said they're the windows of the soul.
You got it! That's why I paint 'em so big.
I've always done it that way.
If you like this style, I'm working on a few new pieces. I've got a little blonde girl in a blue dress that'll tear your heart out.
Baby!
I was... trying to close the deal --
I'm just a salesman! You know, buyers pay more if they meet the painter --
Shh, QUIET!
Don't blow this! Look, we're makin' money! Your pocket, my pocket?
Not all all! But it's not about ego!
Ah, honey! I just wanna share them with the world!
Would you rather have your children piled in a closet... or hanging in someone's living room?
Hey. Who is that remarkably handsome and confident man?
I am!
It's a delight to meet you, Signore!
We made five grand!! Five THOUSAND dollars...!!!
And that wasn't even one of your good ones!
No. No no! One of -- OUR good ones.
Look at those zeroes! We've hit the big time! We are now hanging in the collection of Italian industrialist Dino Olivetti! With his patronage comes credibility! And with credibility comes RESPECT!
Replies.Didascalie: (the spirit of generosity, he hands her a CHECK)

Replies.Reply: Aw c'mon! The paintings say "Keane"!
On behalf of the children of the world, we present this painting to Mayor Christopher!
In the interest of peace through culture, we donate this painting to the people of Russia!
Miss Crawford! In recognition of your cinematic craft, we bestow this painting, "The Lion and the Child"!
Joan said "Marvelous"! MARVELOUS!
Says who?! Like John Q. Public cares?
He digs real art. Your art! It's beautiful. You're beautiful...
Ruben's gonna choke when he sees this!
No, dear, I'm afraid you're confused.
You have a good eye, sweetie. I painted it, but I was trying to mimic your mother's style. You know, the style she USED to paint in.
Ah, my sweet! Are you enjoying the scene?
EVERYONE!
Give a hand to my beautiful wife.
That? Oh, wow. Probably... months.
Oh --! You mean that painting! Uhh, sorry! It's like a jumble of ideas, rattling around in my brain!
What do you mean?
Well, er, I've just always loved kids.
I remember when she was a baby...
Yeah. Cute little thing. I'd stare into those big orbs. Sometimes I'd get out my Brownie and snap a photo...
Janie, sweetie, you need to respect your mother's privacy. Sometimes grownups need alone time.
Is that the ice cream truck? Why don't you go get yourself a fudgesicle?
Whew! Out of this world...!
Ah, Jane's grand! She's eating ice cream! She has new shoes. She has a college fund.
Well I don't want you feeling like a prisoner. Take a break!
Is that a tear...? You've gone deep!
I love it! ...How'd you get the eyes so lifelike? Is it the highlights?
I owe you an apology. I was initially dismissive of your kids, those emotion-
I'm trying! Ah, you know me. See --
Yes! But... what will I say??
Meaning -- what compels me... to paint... these paintings??
Cute.
Funny! Keep 'em coming! You're a regular Steve Allen. You want heat this winter? Help me out!
What would make a grown man paint a picture like this?!
I grew up, surrounded by six sisters.
I grew up in an orphanage?
I grew up... in a world where adults had vanished, and children and kittens ran wild over the desolate landscape!
Well, because... I lived it! I experienced it!
Well -- NO! Of course not. It was after the War. There was destruction everywhere...
I traveled the Continent. The ravages were horrifying...
Good afternoon! Delighted!
How many sales today?
Replies.Didascalie: (he reaches the SEXY BLONDE CLERK and pinches her ass)

Replies.Reply: Whew! Something smells in here. You should open a window.
I dunno. 6:30, 7? ...Didn't Janie get dinner?
When's the last time you washed your hair?
What do you got back there? Lemme see.
"The world"? Baby, it's me!
I'm your number one fan.
But we're husband and wife. We shouldn't have secrets...
It's a completely different style.
It looks like you.
How am I gonna explain that?
That seems a bit confusing. "Keane"
Who'd you tell about the Big Eyes?
Was Dee-Ann here?! Did Dee-Ann see this painting?!
You tell anybody, the empire COLLAPSES! Do you wanna give back the money? We've committed FRAUD!
Janie thinks I'm in here, painting.
That was the honeymoon period!
Jesus, you're so fragile.
Yep! Walter and his girls! With galleries in three cities!
Yeah, we don't talk about it. Sadly, people don't buy lady art.
The bar's over there.
Yeah, Margaret's a superb artist, in her own way. I even steal a few tips from her, now and then!
Behind every great man is a great woman.
Oh, for Christ's sake, Margaret! Dick writes a gossip column --
Let's stick to the family angle. Get a gander at little Janie over there!
What a talent! Look at these Keanes!
Ah! A little treat! The fourth member of the Painting Keanes!
Lily, honey, how are you?!
Really? Did you get in a fight?
Well is the tooth fairy somethin' I gotta deal with, or did your mother already handle it?
Good! Good good! Well, just go throw your stuff in the kids' room, then you can come join the fun!
Didn't I? Sure. Lil's from my first marriage.
That's Lily. I'm sure I mentioned her --
No! Her mom's just going to Vegas for the weekend.
I'm supposed to have her once a month, but I don't make her mom enforce it.
She's a sweet girl.
I put up with your daughter. I never said a peep.
I'm sorry. Sorry! Please... let's just try to get through this.
Yeah, Walter Keane and Gauguin have a lot in common. They both walked away from successful careers to travel the globe, live on a boat...
Psst! Maggie! Can I have a second?
Good grief! What the hell are you babbling about?! Long division??
What the hell's going on here?!!
You KNOW I don't like anyone seeing my work before it's done!
There!
You and your whole non-representational crowd are FRAUDS!!
Get outta my house! My big house!
Go back to sellin' your coat hanger sculptures on Fisherman's Wharf!
I don't want her ever invited here again.
M-Maggie! What're you doin' up?
I had a helluva night. Worked three or four clubs.
You think? I dunno -- I thought you could whip off a doodle of Chinatown.
Yeah? Maybe you're right. She probably doesn't have a Parisian street scene hanging in her palace.
"Cenic"...? Uh, what's that?
Huhhh?
Urgh... oh! CENIC!
Cenic was my nickname in Paris! All my art school pals loved my scenic views, so they called me "Scenic"!
How DARE you accuse me of lying! I'm proud of my early Cenics!
You sound crazy! For God's sake.
I studied art in Paris. I went to school at the Beaux-Arts. The Grand Chaumiere. I spent hours in the Louvre, gazing at the greatness of the Masters...
I wanted... I so wanted to be an artist. But -- it just never turned out good.
What are you working on?
I figured out a solution to our problems.
Teach me.
Show me your tricks. Then you can pass off the Waifs, and we won't be lying anymore.
Sure! Why not?
Y-you're right!
But you know me! I'm a quick study.
So...? What's first?
It's a -- Keane.

Posterity, baby...!!

it is that I was dedicated to the hungry children of the world.

is melting down. In total crisis...
